verses.verse: Lo, mine eye <S%H5869><s%> hath seen <S%H7200><s%> all this, mine ear <S%H241><s%> hath heard <S%H8085><s%> and understood <S%H995><s%> it.
What ye know <S%H1847><s%>, the same do I know <S%H3045><s%> also: I am not inferior <S%H5307><s%> unto you.
Surely <S%H199><s%> I would speak <S%H1696><s%> to the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, and I desire <S%H2654><s%> to reason <S%H3198><s%> with God <S%H410><s%>.
But <S%H199><s%> ye are forgers <S%H2950><s%> of lies <S%H8267><s%>, ye are all physicians <S%H7495><s%> of no value <S%H457><s%>.
O that <S%H5414><s%> ye would altogether <S%H2790><s%> hold your peace <S%H2790><s%>! and it should be your wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> now my reasoning <S%H8433><s%>, and hearken <S%H7181><s%> to the pleadings <S%H7379><s%> of my lips <S%H8193><s%>.
Will ye speak <S%H1696><s%> wickedly <S%H5766><s%> for God <S%H410><s%>? and talk <S%H1696><s%> deceitfully <S%H7423><s%> for him?
Will ye accept <S%H5375><s%> his person <S%H6440><s%>? will ye contend <S%H7378><s%> for God <S%H410><s%>?
Is it good <S%H2895><s%> that he should search you out <S%H2713><s%>? or as one man <S%H582><s%> mocketh <S%H2048><s%> another, do ye so mock <S%H2048><s%> him?
He will surely <S%H3198><s%> reprove <S%H3198><s%> you, if ye do secretly <S%H5643><s%> accept <S%H5375><s%> persons <S%H6440><s%>.
Shall not his excellency <S%H7613><s%> make you afraid <S%H1204><s%>? and his dread <S%H6343><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> upon you?
Your remembrances <S%H2146><s%> are like <S%H4912><s%> unto ashes <S%H665><s%>, your bodies <S%H1354><s%> to bodies <S%H1354><s%> of clay <S%H2563><s%>.
Hold your peace <S%H2790><s%>, let me alone, that I may speak <S%H1696><s%>, and let come <S%H5674><s%> on me what will. Hold: Heb. Be silent from me
Wherefore do I take <S%H5375><s%> my flesh <S%H1320><s%> in my teeth <S%H8127><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%> in mine hand <S%H3709><s%>?

Though <S%H2005><s%> he slay <S%H6991><s%> me, yet will I trust <S%H3176><s%> in him: but I will maintain <S%H3198><s%> mine own ways <S%H1870><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him. maintain: Heb. prove, or, argue
He also shall be my salvation <S%H3444><s%>: for an hypocrite <S%H2611><s%> shall not come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> diligently <S%H8085><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%>, and my declaration <S%H262><s%> with your ears <S%H241><s%>.
Behold now, I have ordered <S%H6186><s%> my cause <S%H4941><s%>; I know <S%H3045><s%> that I shall be justified <S%H6663><s%>.
Who is he that will plead <S%H7378><s%> with me? for now, if I hold my tongue <S%H2790><s%>, I shall give up the ghost <S%H1478><s%>.
Only do <S%H6213><s%> not two <S%H8147><s%> things unto me: then will I not hide <S%H5641><s%> myself from thee <S%H6440><s%>.
Withdraw <S%H7368><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from me: and let not thy dread <S%H367><s%> make me afraid <S%H1204><s%>.
Then call <S%H7121><s%> thou, and I will answer <S%H6030><s%>: or let me speak <S%H1696><s%>, and answer <S%H7725><s%> thou me.
How many are mine iniquities <S%H5771><s%> and sins <S%H2403><s%>? make me to know <S%H3045><s%> my transgression <S%H6588><s%> and my sin <S%H2403><s%>.
Wherefore hidest <S%H5641><s%> thou thy face <S%H6440><s%>, and holdest <S%H2803><s%> me for thine enemy <S%H341><s%>?
Wilt thou break <S%H6206><s%> a leaf <S%H5929><s%> driven to and fro <S%H5086><s%>? and wilt thou pursue <S%H7291><s%> the dry <S%H3002><s%> stubble <S%H7179><s%>?
For thou writest <S%H3789><s%> bitter things <S%H4846><s%> against me, and makest me to possess <S%H3423><s%> the iniquities <S%H5771><s%> of my youth <S%H5271><s%>.

Thou puttest <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> also in the stocks <S%H5465><s%>, and lookest narrowly <S%H8104><s%> unto all my paths <S%H734><s%>; thou settest a print <S%H2707><s%> upon the heels <S%H8328><s%> of my feet <S%H7272><s%>. lookest: Heb. observest heels: Heb. roots
And he, as a rotten thing <S%H7538><s%>, consumeth <S%H1086><s%>, as a garment <S%H899><s%> that is moth <S%H6211><s%> eaten <S%H398><s%>.
